but the first thing I would like to

that has suffered this severe outbreak
it was stopped swiftly in Senegal in

so three countries already have cleared

these countries and it's spread like

and let look at the time in Liberia here

June it was in July it climbed up to
about five cases per day on average and
then came the catastrophe and that was
because the virus has made it into the

came into the capital it increased like
this
this was the terrifying curve you can
see it goes straight up like it and in
September it hit about 50 new cases per
day in the country by then most of those
cases were in the capital and the reason
it could take off like this was that
Ebola was also spreading out from the

people travel a lot
and the spread which we called
exponential is explained by the
seemingly simple but cruel fact that one

those to infect two others and then two
others so the increase will not be one
